questions.question: L = 2500 - 40t; Lyle keeps a track of his monthly expenses. The equation above expresses his remaining savings, L, in dollars, after t months. What is his monthly expense, in dollars?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The coefficient of 't' represents the monthly expense. So, Lyle spends $40 every month.

questions.question: F = 80 - 2x; The equation above denotes the remaining food, F, in kg, in Arturo's fridge after x days. What is the quantity of food Arturo consumes daily?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: Arturo consumes 2 kg of food daily as given by the coefficient of 'x' in the equation.

questions.question: V = 50 - 0.2g; The equation above signifies the volume in litres of water in a tank after g gallons of water have been removed. What is the initial volume of the tank, in litres?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The initial volume of the tank is given by the constant, which equals 50 litres.

questions.question: D = -25h + 5000; The equation shows the distance, D, in kilometres, Francine has to her destination after h hours. What is Francine's speed in kilometres per hour?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: Francine's speed equals the absolute value of the coefficient of 'h', which is 25 km/h.

questions.question: I = 150 - 5t; The equation above indicates Xavier's current investment value, I, in thousands of dollars, t years after the initial investment. What was the initial value of the investment in thousands of dollars?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The initial value of the investment corresponds to the constant in the equation, which is $150,000.
